title: How to Manage Resource Constraints with New Abundance | BCG - BCG
summary: The article discusses the end of abundance in terms of capital, labor, and natural resources, and how companies can adapt to this new reality by finding new sources of abundance through innovation and sustainability. It also discusses the importance of sustainable business models and how companies can decouple their growth from material consumption.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes several examples of green innovations, such as Dell's shift to laptops during the pandemic, Rakuten's transition to English-first to become globally relevant, Totino's development of a modular set of recipes to address ingredient shortages, and TRIMET's investment in technology to allow its smelters to vary energy consumption and aluminum production.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes several examples of business innovations, such as Dell's shift to laptops during the pandemic, Rakuten's transition to English-first to become globally relevant, Totino's development of a modular set of recipes to address ingredient shortages, and TRIMET's investment in technology to allow its smelters to vary energy consumption and aluminum production.
green_product: TRUE. The article describes several examples of green products, such as Cotopaxi's colorful bags and clothing made from fabric scraps, and Golden Goose's luxury sneakers that are built to last and can be repaired.
green_process: TRUE. The article describes several examples of green processes, such as Cotopaxi's use of fabric scraps to reduce waste, and Everytable's use of economies of scale and central kitchens to beat competitor prices for healthy meals.

title: Philipsâ€™ Scope-3 CO2 emissions reduction - News - Philips
summary: Philips, a health technology company, has achieved carbon neutrality in its operations and is committed to reducing indirect CO2 emissions by 42% across its value chain by 2030. Philips has adopted a fully integrated approach to doing business responsibly and sustainably, with ambitious targets and detailed plans of action across all ESG dimensions.

title: Thalia's AMALIA qualified on 12nm FinFET technology - Design and Reuse
summary: Thalia announces the qualification of its AMALIA platform for 12nm FinFET technology, helping customers leverage the latest advanced process technology while saving time and money. The AMALIA platform enables a seamless and efficient migration of analog, mixed-signal, and RF IP to new technologies like 12nm FinFET, accelerating product development cycles. This qualification will strengthen Thalia's position as an innovation leader in the semiconductor industry.

title: Increasing resilience of material supply by decentral urban factories and secondary raw materials - Frontiers
summary: Green innovation contributes to environmental sustainability goals, such as decarbonisation, reducing or replacing harmful substances, reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy, nature and wildlife conservation, or the protection of biological systems. Business innovation is defined as a new or improved product or business process (or combination thereof) that differs significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes and that has been introduced on the market or brought into use by the firm. Green products and processes strive to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability through the use of environmentally benign materials, sustainable production processes, and product functionalities that support recycling and low environmental impact during usage and disposal.

title: European Union launches second edition of Circular Economy Competition - GhanaWeb
summary: The European Union is supporting the circular economy in Ghana through the Circular Economy Competition (CEC). The CEC is a contest that aims to support small businesses and start-ups operating in the circular economy ecosystem in Ghana.  The circular economy is not only about waste or transforming waste through reuse and upcycling into new products. It also offers the potential for an economic boost through resource efficiency and industrial transformation.  Interested applicants should visit www.EU-CEC.COM to apply. Application is open from now to 4th February 2023.
green_innovation: TRUE, The competition aims to support innovative ideas and projects that aim to promote resource efficiency and thinking in Ghana.
business_innovation: TRUE, The competition aims to support small businesses and start-ups operating in the circular economy ecosystem in Ghana.

title: 33 things you need to know about Chris Skidmore's Net Zero Review - ENDS Report
summary: The Skidmore Review, commissioned by the UK government, provides a comprehensive analysis of the UK's progress towards net zero and makes 33 recommendations to accelerate the transition to a low-carbon economy. The review highlights the need for long-term certainty, streamlined planning processes, investment in renewable technologies, and a focus on circular economy principles. Innovation will play a critical role in delivering net zero, but it is essential to ensure that green innovation is not used as a form of greenwashing.
green_innovation: TRUE - The Skidmore Review emphasizes the importance of green innovation for the UK's net zero transition.
business_innovation: TRUE - The Skidmore Review also highlights the significance of business innovation in driving decarbonization.
greenwashing: The Skidmore Review does not provide specific examples of greenwashing, but it does emphasize the importance of avoiding greenwashing by ensuring that green claims are substantiated and credible.
